name: Vegetable Kadai
history: Vegetable Kadai, a popular dish in Indian cuisine, is known for its rich and aromatic gravy. Traditionally cooked in a Kadai (a type of Indian wok), this dish includes a variety of vegetables and is spiced with a special blend of masalas.
description: Vegetable Kadai is a flavorful Indian curry made with mixed vegetables, cooked in a tomato-based sauce, and seasoned with a blend of spices. It's often garnished with fresh coriander and served with Indian bread or rice.

ingredients.item: mixed vegetables (carrots, bell peppers, cauliflower, peas)

instructions.title: SautÃ© the Vegetables
instructions.description: Heat oil in a kadai. Add cumin seeds, and once they splutter, add onions, ginger-garlic paste, and green chilies. SautÃ© until onions turn golden.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Tomatoes
instructions.description: Add coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala. Mix well. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.

instructions.title: Cook the Vegetables
instructions.description: Add the mixed vegetables to the kadai. Season with salt. Add water as needed, cover, and cook until the vegetables are tender.

instructions.title: Add Finishing Touches
instructions.description: Sprinkle kasuri methi over the curry. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.

tips: Cut vegetables into even sizes for uniform cooking.
Adjust the amount of chili to control the spice level.
variations: Add paneer or tofu for extra protein.
Experiment with different combinations of vegetables based on preference.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish for an authentic experience.
Garnish with a lemon wedge and onion rings for added flavor and appeal.
